metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5251 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 48.0 allows remote attackers to spoof the location bar via crafted characters in the media type of a data: URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5251` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
